Keywords Abdominal obesity Ovarian cancer Single nucleotide polymorphisms Toll-like receptors Interaction The Youth Project of Wuxi Municipal Health Commission Q202310 Zhu Jiamin pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement yes pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version no pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint no pmc-prop-in-epmc yes issue-copyright-statement © BioMed Central Ltd., part of Springer Nature 2025 Introduction Ovarian cancer (OC) is the third most common type of gynecological cancer but is the deadliest [ 1 2 3 4 5 7 8 9 Microglia express toll-like receptors (TLRs), which can detect harmful pathogens and trigger inflammatory responses. Specifically, the TLR4 10 TLR4 11 12 13 14 15 16 TLR4 17 18 19 TLR4 TLR4 Materials and methods Subjects From January 2019 to September 2022, all patients with OC were recruited from the Affiliated Jiangyin Hospital of Nantong University and Nantong Tumor Hospital. All patients were diagnosed and classified according to the guidelines of the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) [ 20 21 2 2 1 1 2 Trained staff administered questionnaires to all participants to collect general demographic information, lifestyle information, and clinical gynecological data. They obtained this information through a survey questionnaire (supplementary file 1) and clinical data. Abdominal obesity was defined as a waist circumference (WC) ≥ 90 cm for men and ≥ 80 cm for women [ 22 Genomic DNA extraction and genotyping Four SNPs (rs4986791, rs4986790, rs11536889 and rs7873784) of TLR4 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/ PCR-based RFLP was utilized to determine the genotypes of four selected SNPs. The 25 µ L PCR reaction system includes: 50–100 ng DNA sample, forward and reverse primers 0.5 µ M, 200 µ M dNTPs, 1 U Taq enzyme, 1 x buffer, 1.5 mM MgCl 2 1  Table 1 Description and primers used for genotyping for 4 SNPs with in TLR4 gene ID Chromosome Functional Consequence Primers (5’→3’) Restriction endonucleases Thr399Ile 1196 C > T (rs4986791) 9:117713324 Coding sequence variant missense variant Forward: 5′-GGTTGCTGTTCTCAAAGTGATTTTGGGAGAA − 3′ Reverse: 5′-ACCTGAAGACTGGAGAGTGAGTTAAATGCT − 3′  HinfI 896 A > G Asp299Gly (rs4986790) 9:117713024 Coding sequence variant missense variant Forward: 5′-GATTAGCATACTTAGACTACTACCTCCATG − 3′ Reverse: 5′- GATCAACTTCTGAAAAAGCATTCCCAC − 3′  NcoI rs7873784 (C > G) 9:117716658 3′ UTR Forward: 5′- ACGTTGGATGGTATGCAAGATGAAT TAGCT − 3′ Reverse: 5′- ACGTTGGATGGAACACTTAACATGA GAGGT − 3′  XhoI rs11536889 + 7263G/C 9:117715853 3′ UTR Forward: 5′- ACAAGTGATGTTTGATGGAC − 3′ Reverse: 5′- GCCATTCTACCTGGTATAAG − 3′  EarI Statistical analysis In the current study, the SPSS 22.0 software package (SPSS Inc, Chicago) was used for all statistical analyses. For normally distributed continuous variables, the means and standard deviations (SDs) were calculated. For categorical variables, percentages were calculated. To compare the means and SDs between two groups, Student’s t test was used. To compare the percentages between two groups, χ 2 http://bioinfo.iconcologia.net/SNPstats 23 TLR4 TLR4 p Results This case-control study enrolled 930 participants, consisting of 310 °C patients and 620 normal controls. The mean age of all participants was 61.9 ± 11.8 years. Among them, the mean age of OC patients was 62.7 ± 11.2 years, while that of normal controls was 61.4 ± 10.8 years. Best combination Sign test p Testing balanced accuracy Cross-validation consistency SNP- SNP interaction 1 2 rs4986790, rs11536889 0.018 0.608 10/10 3 rs4986790, rs11536889, rs4986791 0.426 0.540 7/10 4 rs4986790, rs11536889, rs4986791, rs7873784 0.532 0.496 6/10 Gene- AO interaction 2 2 rs4986790, AO 0.001 0.622 10/10 3 rs4986790, rs4986791, AO 0.256 0.549 8/10 4 rs4986790, rs4986791, rs11536889, AO 0.359 0.512 7/10 5 rs4986790, rs4986791, rs11536889, rs7873784, AO 0.624 0.496 6/10 1 2 We also employed logistic regression analysis to examine the SNP- SNP interaction between rs4986790 and rs11536889, as well as the SNP- AO interaction effect between rs4986790 and AO. We found that the risk of OC was highest in participants with the rs4986790- AG/GG and rs11536889-GC/CC genotypes, compared to those with rs4986790-AA and rs11536889-GG genotypes, OR (95%CI) = 2.58 (1.46–3.71). We also found that among participants with rs4986790 - AG/GG genotype, the risk of OC was highest in those with AO. When compared to non- abdominal obese participants with rs4986790 - AA genotype, the OR (95%CI) = 3.17 (1.78–4.58) (Table 5  Table 5 Analysis for SNP-SNP and gene - AO interaction by using logistic regression Variables OR (95% CI) * p SNP- SNP interaction 1 rs4986790-AA and rs11536889-GG 1.00 - rs4986790-AA and rs11536889-GC/CC 1.25 (0.94–1.61) 0.306 rs4986790-AG/GG and rs11536889-GG 1.59 (1.08–2.12) 0.028 rs4986790- AG/GG and rs11536889-GC/CC 2.58 (1.46–3.71) 0.001 Gene- AO interaction 2 rs4986790-AA and normal WC 1.00 - rs4986790-AA and AO 1.36 (1.07–1.69) 0.021 rs4986790-AG/GG and normal WC 1.47 (1.11–1.87) 0.012 rs4986790- AG/GG and AO 3.17 (1.78–4.58) < 0.001 1 2 Discussion In the current study, we found that carriers with the G allele of rs4986790 and the C allele of rs11536889 within the TLR4 TLR2 TLR3 TLR4 TLR5 TLR9. TLR4 24 25 TLR4 26 Previous studies have indicated a statistical association between TLR4 27 28 29 TLR4 15 30 TLR4 TLR4 Asp299Gly 16 The precise biological mechanism by which TLR4 31 TLR4 32 33 The onset of OC is contributed to by many factors, including genetic and environmental factors, as well as their synergistic effects [ 7 TLR4 34 35 36 37 TLR4 TLR4 TLR4 This study had several limitations. First, the sample size of OC patients was limited, which might result in unstable results. In the future, more OC patients should be included to validate the findings of this study. Secondly, all the participants enrolled in this study were of the Chinese Han population. Therefore, the results obtained from this study may not necessarily be representative of populations of other races. In conclusion, this case-control study indicated a statistically significant association between the rs4986790- G allele or with the rs11536889- C allele within TLR4 TLR4 TLR4 Supplementary Information  Supplementary Material 1. Acknowledgements We appreciate the cooperation of the partners and staff who cooperated in this study. Authors’ contributions The manuscript writing, editing, and review were conducted by Zhu J and Tan C, Yang B and Zhai X participated in the genomic DNA extraction and genotyping. Ni Feng and Tao D participated information collection and questionnaire investigation. Funding This study was supported by the Youth Project of Wuxi Municipal Health Commission (Q202310). Data availability The data and tables generated and analyzed during this study are available from the corresponding authors upon reasonable request. Declarations Ethics approval and consent to participate Each participant understood the study process and signed a written informed consent before the study. The protocol was approved by committee of the Affiliated Jiangyin Hospital of Nantong University (2024-L044) in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki.
